question.text:
Which of the following statements about oogenesis are incorrect?

I. The oogonia keep on adding in the ovary till puberty.

II. The primary oocytes are halted at prophase-I of meiotic division.

III. The fluid-filled cavity present in the primary follicle is called the antrum.

IV. The secondary oocyte forms a membrane called zona glomerulosa around it.

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

solution.text:
I. No more oogonia are added to the ovary after birth.
III. The fluid-filled cavity present in the tertiary follicle is called the antrum.
IV. The secondary oocyte forms a membrane called zona pellucida around it.
